question_sentence: What was the cause of delays at major airports across the US this week?
evidence: Flight delays spread to major airports across the country this week due to a shortage of air traffic controllers amid the government shutdown. Air traffic controllers are considered essential employees and must work without pay during a shutdown, so many called in sick.

question_sentence: Why did the Trump administration send National Guard troops to Chicago and Portland, Oregon?
evidence: The Trump administration pointed to protests at ICE facilities as the reason for deploying National Guard troops in Chicago and Portland.

question_sentence: Officials arrested a man this week on suspicion of starting the devastating Palisades Fire. Where did the blaze occur?
evidence: The Palisades Fire decimated the Los Angeles area earlier this year, claiming the lives of a dozen people and burning down thousands of structures. A 29-year-old arson suspect was arrested this week in Florida.

question_sentence: Israel and Hamas agreed to the first phase of a US-brokered ceasefire plan this week. Which of the following is included in the deal?
choices: Permanent peace between Israel and Hamas
Israel taking full control of Gaza
Release of all hostages in Gaza
evidence: The agreement will allow for the release of all hostages in Gaza, Israel’s withdrawal to an agreed point and the release of some Palestinian prisoners.

question_sentence: How many inmates escaped from a New Orleans jail in May, prompting a multistate manhunt?
evidence: Ten inmates escaped from a New Orleans jail nearly five months ago. The last of the 10 prisoners was captured in Atlanta this week following a standoff with police.

question_sentence: A blizzard recently stranded hundreds of trekkers near which mountain?
evidence: Hundreds of trekkers escaped from a blizzard near the eastern face of Mount Everest after heavy snow pummeled the Himalayas.

question_sentence: Which US pharmacy chain recently closed all remaining stores after more than 60 years in business?
evidence: Rite Aid, once one of the biggest pharmacy chains in the US, has closed its remaining 89 stores due to bankruptcy woes and insurmountable debt.

question_sentence: The FBI was recently ordered to urgently search for records related to which historical figure?
evidence: The Trump administration this week ordered FBI employees to urgently search for any records related to the 1937 disappearance of Amelia Earhart.

question_sentence: Which state banned ultraprocessed foods in public schools?
evidence: California made history Wednesday by enacting the first law in the US to define and ultimately ban ultraprocessed foods in the state's public schools.

question_sentence: Which singer recently released a new album titled “The Life of a Showgirl”?
evidence: Taylor Swift’s new album, “The Life of a Showgirl,” sparked some unfavorable reactions upon its release — but the pop star seems to be unbothered by the mixed reception.
